newsitem.title: USA: Executive says graphics to aid Internet commerce.
newsitem.headline: Executive says graphics to aid Internet commerce.

text.p: Developments in computer graphics and real-time video will advance Internet commerce to the next level by offering consumers a tailored shopping experience, a software executive said Friday.

Video "does a much better job of grabbing your attention and certainly conveys an awful lot more information in 15 seconds than you're going to get with a banner ad that blinks at you," William Kelly, general counsel for Silicon Graphics, said in a keynote speech at the Internet Commerce Expo.

Kelly said Internet sales offer the opportunity for one-to-one, personalized service and marketing. "The best people in this business are using sound marketing practices and extending them to the Web, using the Web as an extension of their existing businesses," he said.
Capturing customer preferences also makes their visit to a commercial Web site more "useful and personal," Kelly said.
Businesses trying to reach consumers through the Internet should drive customers to their site and engage them once they are there, Kelly said.
He advised that businesses should gather customer information when consumers use a Web site and provide a safe and secure environment for commerce.

Kelly also said people buying products through the Internet should be allowed to interact with other customers to foster a sense of community. The World Wide Web should also allow purchases and returns to be made as easily as possible, he said.
